page.title: 09Interview with Mr.Grace
page.content: The next question we asked him was, "Was there anything on the school grounds before it was built?"His answer was, "Well, no it was an agricultural field and where the church is near Faversham close was all one big field." Finally we asked him "How long has Tring Market been going on for?" He answerd, "Well the Market charter was given by Edward III.The charter was given at Kings Langley when there was a Royal Palace there. Then the market fell into the hands of the Archbishop of Canterbury who was rather hard on Tring and used to charge very high tolls.Eventually a new market charter was given by Charles 2nd in about 1680."
